prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a curved top edge Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will be the base coordinate system for the entire CAD model. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Next, draw the 2D sketch for the rectangular prism with a curved top edge. The sketch should be drawn on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch will consist of three main faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, and face\\_3), each with one or more loops, lines, and/or arcs. Face 1 (Top Face) Face\\_1 will have three loops. * Loop 1: Loop 1 will consist of the following curves: 1. line\\_1: Starting from point [0.0, 0.0], end at point [0.75, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Starting from point [0.75, 0.0], end at point [0.75, 0.0625] 3. line\\_3: Starting from point [0.75, 0.0625], end at point [0.6563, 0.1563] 4. line\\_4: Starting from point [0.6563, 0.1563], end at point [0.5392, 0.1563] 5. arc\\_1: Starting from point [0.5392, 0.1563], ending at point [0.2108, 0.1563], with midpoint at [0.375, 0.0609] 6. line\\_5: Starting from point [0.2108, 0.1563], end at point [0.0938, 0.1563] 7. line\\_6: Starting from point [0.0938, 0.1563], end at point [0.0, 0.0625] 8. line\\_7: Starting from point [0.0, 0.0625], end at point [0.0, 0.0] * Loop 2: Loop 2 will consist of a single circle: 1. circle\\_1: Center at [0.23, 0.105], radius of 0.0068 * Loop 3: Loop 3 will consist of a single circle: 1. circle\\_1: Center at [0.375, 0.0449], radius of 0.0068 * Loop 4: Loop 4 will consist of a single circle: 1. circle\\_1: Center at [0.52, 0.105], radius of 0.0068 Face 2 (Front Face) Face\\_2 will have a single loop, with no lines or arcs. Face 3 (Back Face) Face\\_3 will have a single loop, with no lines or arcs. Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Now, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the extrusion coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. The 3D sketch should now be defined in the context of the new coordinate system. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Lastly, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a distance of 0.0078. The top face will effectively become a curved surface due to the addition of the small circles on the face\\_1. This creates a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. Final Shape Information The final CAD shape will be a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. The length, width, and height of the final shape are as follows: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0078</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole** The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions of the prism are as follows: * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.375 units Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. * The sketch will contain two faces: face_1 and face_2 (which will be created by the cylindrical hole). * face_1 will contain two loops: loop_1 and loop_2 (the hole). * loop_1 will contain four lines: line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4. These lines will create a rectangle. + line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] + line_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.75] + line_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.75] + line_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.75], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] * loop_2 will contain one circle: circle_1, which creates the cylindrical hole in the center of the prism. + circle_1: Center = [0.4026, 0.3798], Radius = 0.1875 Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.375 units to create the three-dimensional prism shape. Create the cylindrical hole by extruding the circle_1 loop of face_1 along the opposite direction with an extrusion depth of 0.375 units. This step will remove the material during the extrusion process to create the hole. This completes the instructions for constructing part 1. Continue with the next part of the CAD assembly and repeat the process.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2426, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system using the given loop and lines: - loop_1 - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0265, 0.0] - line_2: [0.0265, 0.0] to [0.0265, 0.0265] - line_3: [0.0265, 0.0265] to [0.0, 0.0265] - line_4: [0.0, 0.0265] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale: 0.0265 4. Generate a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from step 1. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model with extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.1213 and extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0.1213. Part 2: Larger Rectangular Prism Construct a larger rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is centered on the white background. The front face of the prism is angled slightly to the right. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 1 unit in length, 0.5 units in width, and 0.25 units in height. The prism is a solid object with no holes or openings. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler angles and translation vector: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0265, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system using the given loop and lines: - loop_1 - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.0265, 0.0] - line_2: [0.0265, 0.0] to [0.0265, 0.0265] - line_3: [0.0265, 0.0265] to [0.0, 0.0265] - line_4: [0.0, 0.0265] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch_scale: 0.0265 4. Generate a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from step 1. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to create the 3D model with extrude_depth_towards_normal = 0.7235, extrude_depth_opposite_normal = 0, and use a boolean operation to join the previous part. The resulting CAD design is a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat base and a flat top that is slightly tapered toward the top. The design consists of the above-described parts.</description>
